name: resistive
content:
resistive adjective
(NOT AFFECTED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not harmed or affected by something: resistive to The wooden frame was coated to make it more resistive to fire. They did everything they could to make the house as resistive to storms as possible.
More examplesFewer examplesLet us assume that when the ball hits the ground, it is subject to a resistive force of constant magnitude.

resistive adjective
(PHYSICS)
relating to or showing electrical resistance (= the degree to which a substance prevents the flow of an electric current through it): The touchscreen is coated with a resistive material. In a resistive circuit, the voltage is equal to current multiplied by resistance.
More examplesFewer examplesThe total charging current not attributable to resistive current flow is shown on the vertical axis of the graph.A resistive load is an electrical device that comprises a heating element, such as a light bulb.The device employs a thin-film resistive sensor.
